newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Details of Russian Eurobond issues.
newsitem.headline: Details of Russian Eurobond issues.

text.p: The road-show for St Petersburg's debut Eurobond will start on May 23.
Sverdlovsk region could be ready to start presenting its first Eurobond in two months time.
Promstroibank St Petersburg plans to issue up to $50 million in three to five year Eurobonds in 1997 via CS First Boston.
Samara region plans to start Eurobond issues this July and is to issue $250-$400 million worth of paper in several issues with a monthly interval.
Russia said it will hold a road-show for its next dollar-denominated Eurobond June 11-18.
The City of Moscow is expected to launch its debut Eurobond next week. It is also considering launching a second Eurobond this year, if the first issue is successful.
Russian entities have issued the following Eurobonds and announced the following plans for issues:
ISSUED:

RUSSIAN FEDERATION - March 1997, 2.0 billion marks, seven years (maturing March 25, 2004); leads Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, CS First Boston; coupon 9.0 pct, priced to yield 370 basis points over seven-year (March 2004) German government bonds; S&P BB-

RUSSIAN FEDERATION - November 1996, five years (maturing November 27, 2001); leads JP Morgan, SBC Warburg; coupon 9.25 pct, priced to yield 345 points over five-year U.S. Treasuries (5.875 pct notes due November 30, 2001); Moody's Ba2, S&P BB-, IBCA BB+
PLANNED:
SOVEREIGN
RUSSIAN FEDERATION - Dollar Eurobond planned in the second half of June; at least seven years; leads JP Morgan, SBC Warburg; road-show June 11-18
RUSSIAN FEDERATION - at least one other Eurobond in autumn of 1997, currency to be determined
RUSSIAN FEDERATION - rouble Eurobond in 1998
RAILWAYS MINISTRY - dollar Eurobond in 1997, few hundred million dollars
REGIONS AND MUNICIPALITIES
CHELYABINSK - $100 million
IRKUTSK REGION - early 1998, $80 million; advisers All-Russian Bank for Regional Development (agent), ING-Barings (ratings consultant)
ING-Barings to recommend S&P and Moody's rating agencies.
ING-Barings said it had an advantage in being chosen as lead-manager
KOMI REPUBLIC - $200 million, five years
LENINGRAD REGION (no details)
MARY EL REPUBLIC - likely to drop Eurobond plans
MOSCOW (CITY) - roadshow May 11-23, 1997, $400 million, three years; leads CS First Boston and Nomura International; Moody's Ba2, S&P BB-
MOSCOW (REGION) - up to $400 million, three to five years; lead SBC Warburg; expects ratings from Moody's and IBCA in May
NIZHNY NOVGOROD - up to $100 million late June 1997; five-years; Moody's Ba2, S&P BB-
ST PETERSBURG - 1997, up to $300 million, two-five years; lead Salomon Bros; S&P BB-, IBCA BB+ for long-term investment, B for short-term investment; road-show starts May 23;
SVERDLOVSK - August 1997; $100 million, six-seven years (plans total $300 million over several years); leads WestMerchant Bank, Inkombank (adviser/co-manager)
TATARSTAN REPUBLIC - end 1997, $200 million
SAMARA REGION - July 1997; $250-$400 million in several issues with a monthly interval
CORPORATE
ALMAZY ROSSII-SAKHA (ARS) - $100 million by end of 1997; later $300 million annually
GAZPROM - 1997
LUKOIL - 1998 at earliest
MGTS - July or September 1997, about $150 million, three to five years, 9.5 pct; leads CS First Boston, Salomon Bros
MOSENERGO - late 2nd qtr/early 3rd qtr 1997, $150 million, about five years; lead Salomon Bros; expects S&P rating in May
RED OCTOBER - about $20 million; K.O. Finansy (adviser)
ROSTELEKOM - 1997; S&P BB-
TATNEFT - second half 1997 or later; lead Dresdner Kleinwort Benson (recommended)
BANKS
INKOMBANK - mid-1997, two-three years
NATSIONALNY REZERVNY BANK - rating in 1997
UNEXIMBANK - mid-1997, $100-200 million, three-five years
PROMSTROIBANK ST PETERSBURG - 1997, $50 million, via CS First Boston
--Moscow Newsroom, +7095 941 8520
